intro: Euploca aequorea, commonly known as the white euploca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Euploca aequorea is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
